ygData.subject: RE: Rumor of the bards ultimate weapon?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... The Tier dal Seargents were blue to me at level 40.  The Tier dal Lieutenants were red to me, yellow to a L45 friend. The named NPCs were red to the L45
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 1 Nov 1999, Katy Westerman wrote:
>
> Well, E'ci's version of the event got screwed up by some greedy high
> leevls. Most all of the good NPC's were killed and I don't think
> anyone got rewarded except for those who got to loot the undead and
> dark elves (read greedy high level bastards). The high levels weren't
> all bad, though, some would leave the loot if they couldn't use it and
> broadcast to the zone where it was...so some greedy high level
> (who probably couldn't use it) would come and pick it up. Bitter?
> Nah. Actually I only died once in the whole thing, when I was blinded
> by Innoruk's hate.

The Tier'dal Seargents were blue to me at level 40. The
Tier'dal Lieutenants were red to me, yellow to a L45 friend.
The named NPCs were red to the L45 friend. If the high level
people hadn't killed all the "good" NPCs (I assume you mean
good-potential-loot NPCs), the low level people probably
would've died a lot more. Of course my server (Karana)
crashed before the culmination of the event (210 people in
Kithicor will do that).

My friends who stuck around afterwards and played a bit in the
"new" Kithicor say most of the mobs there were blue-yellow at
level 40. Seems Verant is trying to give the L40-50 folks
more areas to play in.

What *was* amusing was a lot of the high level folks had the
"it's blue, kill it" attitude so ingrained that they ended up
killing NPCs that were on our side. Hope they enjoy the
faction loss.

--
John H. Kim
